name: Words with W Trivia Game | Words N - Z | 10 Questions

questions.text: Wootz steel of high carbon was made from what city?
questions.explanation:
Damascus.

	Originally known as 'Ukku', Wootz steel originated in India around the 3rd century A.D.

questions.text: What type of bottle in chemistry has more than one neck?
questions.explanation:
Woulfe.

	The Woulfe bottle was named for the English chemist Peter Woulfe.  Gases are passed through liquids in these bottles.

questions.text: A wyvern most resembles which of the following creatures?
questions.explanation:
Dragon.

	Usually, wyverns walk on two legs rather than four.  Wyverns have barbed tails that resembles those of snakes, and do not breathe fire.

questions.text: Which group of people would most likely be found constructing a wickiup?
questions.explanation:
Native Americans.

	A wickiup is an oval-framed hut covered with vegetable matter or animal skins.  Wickups could be found throughout the American southwest in olden times.

questions.text: The shortened form (with a "W") of which man's name has provided a word for a silly person in Britain?
questions.explanation:
Walter.

	The shortened form Wally has come to refer to someone who is inept.

questions.text: Which of the following words refers to a political party succeeded by the Liberals in the U.K. and the Republicans in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Whigs.

	The word Whig can also refer to a Scottish Presbyterian during the 17th century.  The word is short for Whiggamore (to drive a mare).

questions.text: Witzelsucht is what form of humour?
questions.explanation:
Failed.

	Witzelsucht is a German word referring to puns, poor jokes and pointless anecdotes.  The tendency is for the jokes to be bad.

questions.text: What kind of animal is a Wobbegong?
questions.explanation:
Shark.

	A wobbegong is a type of carpet shark found in the waters of Australia.

questions.text: What is a lion-tailed macaque also known as?
questions.explanation:
Wanderoo.

	Because of its mane-like hair around its head, it is known as the lion-tailed macaque (Macaca silenus).  Wanderoo is the local name (southwest India).

questions.text: Which of these words gets its name from the Spanish word for hammer?
questions.explanation:
Machete.

	The Spanish word is 'macho'.  Thanks for playing, I hope you enjoyed the quiz.
